data.title: Good Food/Good Prices
data.text: We like this Chili's a lot. The prices are very reasonable and the food is good too. The Happy Hour in the bar area is not as good as it was. They have taken things off of the Happy Hour menu that we liked a lot. Still a good place to go.

data.title: Don't order the steak or broccoli!
data.text: Visited Chili's Yorba Linda just a couple of nights ago, where we ordered the "2 for $22" menu item.  I ordered the 6 oz. sirloin steak option.  It was great looking when it arrived at the table, BUT it wasn't great tasting at all!  Totally underdone (per my order) and so salty we took it home for the dog. So, I survived on the mashed potatoes and the 'steamed' broccoli.  However, the broccoli ALSO reeked of heavy salt!  I mentioned to one of the managers that we never order soup at Chili's any more because it is also way too salty for us.  But, why over-salted broccoli?  And, why do restaurant kitchens feel compelled to dump so much salt on the food they prepare?  Let the DINER salt to their own taste, please!  Manager comp'ed the meal but we are unlikely to return.

data.title: Great food, good prices
data.text: We usually eat at Chilis once a month because I crave the chips and salsa. The chips are very good here because they are thin, light and crunchy but still do well with the salsa. You may have more difficulty with the guacamole though because the chips are so thin. The margherita flatbread is very good too. Sign up for the rewards and you will regularly get emails with discounts and free offers.

data.title: Sunday afternoon lunch
data.text: The hostess was gracious and allowed us to be seated in a quiet section away from noisy, crowded tables.  There is a wide variety of menu from which we could choose.  In our group were two school age children and they appreciated being able to select on the menu geared to their likes.  The food was prepared to each adults' satisfaction, and the portions were appropriate.

data.title: Good food, good service, reasonable prices
data.text: My wife and I go here about once a month and always enjoy the experience.  There are usually special deals and the food is always good.

data.title: Good food and great menu
data.text: Chili's is are go-to restaurant to get a quick bite to eat at a reasonable price. The menu has lots of options and there is something for everyone. We like to start with the chips and salsa which are exceptional. The chips are super thin and the salsa is very flavorful. The tableside guacamole is another great choice for appetizer. Everything we have tried from fried cheese to pizza has been delicious. Sign up for the rewards program and you'll have your first free appetizer in about one visit.

data.title: great menu
data.text: There are many restaurants of this type with a large and varied menu, but of all the ones I have tried, this is the best. The prices are fair and the food and service is excellent

data.title: Not good
data.text: It was our Grandson's 8th Birthday, he wanted to eat at Chili's, although one of the grills was down, the service was not good, we told hem that it was his birthday, he cried when we left, because they did not sing happy birthday toi him and bring him a piece of cake, we ate at the Chili's in Chino Hills and he saw them do that for someone there, that is why he wanted to eat at a Chili's we were in this area and stopped at this one. The service was so bad that they they could not figure out what to serve, the kids had soup, my wife and I did nit eat, the kids were hungry and they wanted to go to Taco Bell in Chino Hills, where they have great service, we had his Birthday dinner at Taco Bell and had great service there. How can you not sing happy birthday to an 8 year old that want to go to Chili's. Sad

data.title: Good service, poor food
data.text:
Generally chili's is better than your average chain. Our experience at this location was poor at best. The only thing keeping this from 1 star is our waiter was very attentive. 

Ordered the black bean patty as part of one of their new burgers, the patty was burned to the point that is was extremely crunchy. Ordered sweet potato fries that came out about 5 minutes after the main course. We ordered a turkey sandwich to go with no lettuce or tomatoes and it came out with tomatoes and had to sent back. 
They have the pay at your table pad and it had the wrong bill on it. When we got the paper bill we had been charged for games on the pad that we did not use. 

We were hoping for something better and were very disappointed.

data.title: Tasty, quick and reasonable.
data.text: I had the opportunity to come to this restaurant for a business lunch. We were seated promptly and the waitress took our lunch order shortly thereafter. It seems like our food was brought out from the kitchen in no time. Wow, was it tasty. I'm not sure if it was the food or the service, but lunch was over in no time flat!

data.title: The new menu is awesome!
data.text:
Yes I was bummed that they have removed the Country Fried Steak from the menu. This was a staple that we always liked at Chili's. But, that forced me to try the Top Shelf Jalapeno BBQ Enchiladas. What a treat! Who would know that BBQ sauce was going to add so much to the taste of the dish. It was EXCELLENT!!  I haven't liked a dish at Chili's this much since they dropped the Margarita Tuna Steak (years ago). If you even think you like Tex-Mex you have to try this dish. And if you have not been back to Chili's for a bit this dish alone makes it worth the trip.

And they also have new table-top kiosks where you can reorder drinks, play games, order dessert and pay your bill right there on the table. It even prints a receipt of the transaction. This is really cool.

But, I would avoid Sunday afternoons. For whatever reason, this restaurant is like others in this area when it comes to running with a skeleton staff. Service, in general, is not what Chili's (or other restaurants for that matter) used to be. There were a lot of tables that took a long time to get cleaned.

data.title: Very Good food.  We Take Out only
data.text:
Chili's Restaurant has very good food.  The only problem is it's very noisey, therefore, we always order take out.  We like the 2 for $20.00 deal for dinner,  I like the ribs and my Husband likes their Steak.
You get an appitizer. 2 entries and 2 sides for $20.00.

data.title: NO GIRLS ALLOWED
data.text: Great place to gain weights. Almost every dishes are loaded with fat, cheese, sugar, butter. Even the waitress are heavy. Sorry that tripadvisor does not allow large lettering.reading small lettering is bad for your eyes later on. Always listen to the doctors

data.title: Group lunch
data.text: The service was great for a large group.  They asked if we were in a hurry or wanted a relaxed lunch.  We had an appointment for a tour so we were in a hurry and they accommodateed us very well.  The food was also delicious.

data.title: Does anybody work around here?
data.text:
Receipt Information:
Chili's Grill & Bar #133  at 15380 Yorba Linda, Yorba Linda, CA 92886
7/26/13 at 1: 23 pm  Table number 72/1   Guests 2     70021

My friend and I went to Chili's for a quick bite to eat while my mom had surgery at a near by hospital.    Upon arrival we were greeted by the Hostess who quickly seated us at table 72/1.   Upon arrival both my friend and I commented that it appeared someone forgot to finish cleaning the table.   The Hostess smiled and politely awaiting for us to sit.    She proceeded to inform us that Denise and  Kristen would be our server and walked away... never to return to the table.   What?   She sat us at a dirty table and didn't retrieve a rag to clean the table?!?!??   Wow.

One of our waitresses, Denise arrived and again we mentioned the unclean table; then went on to place our order.   Poof!  She disappeared.   She returned with our drinks and still no rag to clean.   I made mention to please keep an eye on my drink as I tended to drink a lot of tea throughout the meal.  We were assured it wouldn't be a problem.... although we weren't hopeful as a the table remained dirty.   Sure enough, although I pushed my empty glass to the edge of the table.   Denise proceeded to walk by and ignore the silent beckon for a refill.     Several minutes later, Kristin walked by with her hands full, came to a dead stop, acknowledged the empty glasses and promptly returned with refills.

Denise continued to walk by, empty handed, and ignore additional empty glasses on the edge of the table.    Once again, Kristin walked by in the middle of clearing a table, and acknowledged our empty glasses and returned with refills.

Once done with our meal, Denise again walked by and failed to offer  check.   It was Kristen who came to clear our table, ask if we wished additional items and brought our check.      

It appears that only ONE person works at this establishment:   Kristin!
It was Kristen who was seen serving food, cleaning tables and offering refills.    It was Kristen who asked if our food was okay, if we needed something else,  presented our check and accepted our payment.     AMAZING!!!!

The food was good, but the service by all, except Kristen, left this customer highly unsatisfied.

data.title: Nice place for lunch
data.text: Went here on the way home from the Nixon Presidential Library, it was good food with nice service. They let a small dog (not a therapy dog) in the place and the people with the dog had lunch there. Not sure the health department likes dogs in restaurants.

data.title: As good as any Chilli's
data.text:
Stopped by here with some friends and family. 

Service was good, food was good, but as of every Chilli's Ive ever been to, no matter what I order I leave feeling bloated and thirsty,  Everything is SOOO SALTY!!

Overall good despite that.

data.title: Favorite Hangout
data.text: Usually a short wait, this place is our favorite hangout. Its a bit noisy, but food is always good and service is usually good.

data.title: Good speacials with email club
data.text: Nice selection of food. Big enough bar area for happy hour specials. Easy to eat a quick meal getting in/out quick by eating in bar area when solo.

data.title: good chain family place
data.text: ok, its a template restaurant, but they have some good stuff
